title: Zero Point Interchange
text: Zero Point Interchange is a large <a href="cloverleaf%20interchange">cloverleaf interchange</a> in <a href="Islamabad">Islamabad</a>, Pakistan, at the intersection of the <a href="Islamabad%20Expressway">Islamabad Highway</a>, <a href="Kashmir%20Highway">Kashmir Highway</a>, and Khayaban-e-Suharwardy. The interchange was designed by ECIL, and construction work started on 11 September 2008. The interchange was formally inaugurated in July 2011 by then <a href="Prime%20Minister%20of%20Pakistan">Prime Minister of Pakistan</a>, <a href="Yousaf%20Raza%20Gillani">Yousaf Raza Gillani</a>, though construction work on a loop was still in progress. The construction of the interchange was fully completed in 2012. The project cost about <a href="Pakistani%20rupee">PKR</a> 4 billion.
